title: Arancine
source: The Food of Sicily - Fabrizia Lanza
categories: The Food of Sicily - Fabrizia Lanza
ingredients: - Fine sea salt and freshly ground black pepper
- 1½ cups (300 g) risotto rice (Carnaroli, Arborio, or Vialone Nano)
- Fine sea salt and freshly ground black pepper
- 2⅓ cups (250 g) plain dried bread crumbs, plus more for dusting
directions: 1. Make the filling: Heat olive oil in a medium saucepan over medium-high heat. Sauté onion, carrot, and celery until softened, about 5 minutes. Add the meats and cook until browned, 6–8 minutes. Stir in tomato sauce and peas. Dissolve estratto in wine, then add to the pan. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer until thickened, about 30 minutes. Season with salt and pepper. Let cool completely, at least 1 hour or overnight in the fridge.

2. Cook the rice: In a medium saucepan, heat olive oil over medium. Sauté onion until softened, about 8 minutes. Stir in rice to coat. Add water and bring to a boil. Add saffron, stir, cover, and remove from heat. Let sit until tender and water is absorbed, about 20 minutes. Stir in cheese, season to taste, and spread on a sheet pan to cool.
3. Prepare the coating: In a dish, whisk flour, water, and eggs until smooth. Spread bread crumbs in a second dish. Dust a baking sheet with bread crumbs. Keep a bowl of cold water nearby.

4. Shape the arancine: With wet hands, scoop ¼ cup rice into your palm. Press to form a hollow center. Add 1 tablespoon filling and close rice around it. Shape into a ball the size of a small orange. Roll in egg mixture, then bread crumbs. Place on the prepared pan. Repeat with remaining ingredients.

5. Fry the arancine: Heat 2 inches of oil in a heavy pot over medium-high heat. Line a plate with paper towels. Fry arancine in batches until golden, about 3 minutes, turning and basting to cook evenly. Drain on the paper towels.
